summary: The document is a classified memorandum concerning the JFK assassination records, highlighting Robert Maheu's involvement with the Office of Security in 1959. It outlines arrangements made under alias names and notes the absence of derogatory information during the investigation period from May to an unspecified month in 1959. The document, part of the historical review program under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992, carries restrictions.
key_findings: Robert Maheu was involved in arrangements made by the Office of Security in 1959.
Activities were conducted under alias names.
No derogatory information was found during the investigation period.
The document is restricted and was reviewed as part of the JFK assassination records release.
